Ali MacGraw BBC News in Washington the
protests have placed race relations in
the u.s. firmly in the headlines the
governor of New York State Andrew Cuomo
has warned of chronic institutionalized
racism in Atlanta two police officers
who used tasers on two young black
people driving in a car on Saturday
night have been fired the students aged
20 and 22 were detained shortly after
the 9:00 p.m. curfew came into force a
CBS News crew was filming at the time
the incident began this is what happened
and we should warn you you might find
this footage disturbing okay so just to
give you a little background we were
here on the scene we turn around and we
see several officers go up to the car
and start breaking the glass we're not
sure what led up to this there was a
woman in the front passenger seat and a
gentleman in the driver's seat they're
pulling him out now a lot have come up
and now of course the crowd has caught
on to what's happened we have no idea
what led to this they flattened the tire
broke the glass to the car and I hear
what I believe to be a Taser so you can
see this young woman is being arrested
was taken out of the car and then on the
other side we've got the driver who is
also being arrested in several officers
around
I have no idea what exactly led up to
this the two officers were fired by
Atlanta's mayor Keisha Lance bottoms
after she reviewed their body cam
footage three other officers are being
investigated but the two young students
who were tasered 22 year-old Messiah and
20 year-old Tony a pilgrim who say they
were driving home from taking part in
protests have both been released from
custody and will not face any charges
some police and National Guard members

although some told him he should have

California and these pictures are just
in from a furniture store near Chicago a
hammer was used to smash a window before
people made off with items including TVs
and rugs civil rights leaders a version
end to the looting saying it has nothing
to do with George Floyd whose death
sparked the nationwide unrest his family
have also called for the looting to stop
saying they want his legacy to be one of
